issue.title: [CF 591] Cloning Text Layout
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: If your issue is only occurring with a specific icon, include an export string of the icon in this ticket. Subsequently, if the issue involves an entire group or an entire profile, include the entire export string of the group or profile.

To get an export string, open the icon editor, and click button labeled "Import/Export/Backup". Select the "To string" option for the appropriate export type (icon, group, or profile), and then press CTRL+C to copy it to your clipboard.

FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1.  Customize Icon Layout
2. Clone it
3.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?
See a clone.
Group settings window completely black.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)
6.0.2

Do you have an error log of what happened?

8x Components\IconModules\IconModule_Texts\Config.lua:70: bad argument #1 to "strtrim" (string expected, got table)
<in C code>
Components\IconModules\IconModule_Texts\Config.lua:70: in function <Components\IconModules\IconModule_Texts\Config.lua:57>
(tail call): ?

(tail call): ?

> Posted by CurseForge user ElectricMenace | Imported from CurseForge issue #591 | Raw

comments.body:
You need to post the export string of the text layout that you were trying to clone when this error happened.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Nevermind. Managed to reproduce this one.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

Note about above: This completely kills the LUA in saved variables and cripples the addon.

I had to manually search for the Text Layout tag and wipe out the offender.

If seems that Import (Create new) from string and clone do a great job at cloning the text layout but they don't put a name in the definition which causes the above error since it's empty.


> Posted by CurseForge user ElectricMenace

Crap. I thought I uploaded the fix for this last night, but I guess I didn't.

Should be fixed in r582, and any broken layouts will be fixed when upgrading to this version as well.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras
